      • createTableViewTitle

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String createTableViewTitle(RequestContext inRc,
                                                               IDescriptionDefinition inTableDescription,
                                                               DataQuery inQuery)
        Mimic ViewHelper.createTableViewTitle() todo refactor

        This method creates the title to be shown as the title of a table view. The title is calculated as following:

        1. add the description title (if available)
        2. if the description title is not available but the query is not null, add the query's backing entity name (if available)
        3. if no title has been successfully calculated, add the description id
        If the title is surrounded by curly races, the curly braces are removed.

        Parameters:
        inRc - request context
        inTableDescription - the description of the table
        inQuery - data query
        Returns:
        table view title string

      • createFormViewTitle

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String createFormViewTitle(RequestContext inRc,
                                                              IDescriptionDefinition inFormDescription,
                                                              FormAction inFormAction,
                                                              java.util.Map inSubstitutions,
                                                              java.lang.String inTitle)
        Mimic ViewHelper.createFormViewTitle() todo refactor

        This method creates the title of a form view dialog. The title is calculated as following:

        1. add the description title (if available)
        2. if the description title is not available and the description is a form, add the form's backing entity name (if available)
        3. if no title has been successfully calculated, add the description id
        4. resolve any parameters using the specified substitution map
        The calculated title is preppended with the specified form action, unless the calculated title is surrounded by curly braces. Parameters are tagged with a leading and trailing hash character (#), e.g. #country#, and will be replaced with the map value for the matching map key, e.g. key country being mapped to value Mali.

        Example 1: Country -> 'Edit Country', Example 2: {Country} -> 'Country', Example 3: {Country #ctry#}-> 'Country Mali'

        Parameters:
        inRc - request context
        inFormDescription - the description of the form
        inFormAction - the form action of the form view
        inSubstitutions - a map of parameter names (String) to parameter values (String) to use for substitution
        inTitle - title value from the variform definition
        Returns:
        form title

      • isUserActionDisplayable

        public static boolean isUserActionDisplayable(@Nullable
                                              UserAction inAction,
                                              @Nullable
                                              java.lang.String inVariformId)
        This method is used to determine if command(s) secured by the passed in UserAction should be displayed in the UI (e.g., button or menu item).

        The algorithm checks the FrameworkConfig.SHOW_COMMANDS_NOT_GRANTED_BY_SECURITY configuration. If this returns true then the command secured by the UserAction is displayed in the UI, even if the user does not have privileges to execute it (it will be disabled in this case). However, if the configuration is false then the the command is not displayed in the UI if the user does not have privileges to execute the command.

        If the user has privileges to execute the command secured by the UserAction then this method always returns true.

        If the passed in UserAction is null then false is returned.

        Parameters:
        inAction - The UserAction the security permission and configuration is being checked against.
        inVariformId - The Variform ID of the view the UserAction is securing.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the command secured by the UserAction can be displayed in the UI, and false otherwise.

      • isUserActionDisplayable

        public static boolean isUserActionDisplayable(boolean inIsUserActionGrantedBySecurity,
                                              @Nullable
                                              UserAction inAction)
        This method is used to determine if command(s) secured by the passed in UserAction should be displayed in the UI (e.g., button or menu item).

        The algorithm checks the FrameworkConfig.SHOW_COMMANDS_NOT_GRANTED_BY_SECURITY configuration. If this returns true then the command secured by the UserAction is displayed in the UI, even if the user does not have privileges to execute it (it will be disabled in this case). However, if the configuration is false then the the command is not displayed in the UI if the user does not have privileges to execute the command.

        If the user has privileges to execute the command secured by the UserAction then this method always returns true.

        If the passed in UserAction is null then false is returned.

        Parameters:
        inIsUserActionGrantedBySecurity - This boolean indicates if the user has security permission to see the UserAction (true) or not (false).
        inAction - The UserAction the security permission and configuration is being checked against.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the command secured by the UserAction can be displayed in the UI, and false otherwise.

      • getTranslationFromRawKey

        @NotNull
public static java.lang.String getTranslationFromRawKey(java.lang.String inRawKey,
                                                                  java.lang.String inAlternateKeyPath)
        Gets a translation, if any, for a given raw key. If none is found, it will use the alternate key path to see if any thing else is found.
        Parameters:
        inRawKey - raw key
        inAlternateKeyPath - alternate key path, e.g., variform.MY_ID.title
        Returns:
        translation if any found; otherwise, it returns the raw key.

        public static java.lang.String getConfigSettingCountry()
        This method returns the region to use for the date form widget. It is obtained from the config settings and if there is a problem it defaults to ISO. From com.navis.framework.ulc.server.application.view.form.widget.factory.DateFormWidgetFactory
        Returns:
        The region to use for the date form widget (never null).

      • addOrUpdateEntity

        public static BizResponse addOrUpdateEntity(java.lang.String inEntityName,
                                            java.io.Serializable inEntityGkey,
                                            FieldChanges inOutFieldChanges)
        Helper method to do a simple update of an entity
        Parameters:
        inEntityName - the entitry to create or update
        inEntityGkey - the gkey of the entity, may be null for a create
        inOutFieldChanges - field changes to apply
        Returns:
        BizResponse, should be checked for errors

      • wrapCommandIfNecessary

        @Nullable
public static IBaseCommand wrapCommandIfNecessary(java.lang.Object inCommand)
        This method takes in a command and wraps it in an IBaseCommand so it can be executed in the IBaseCommand pattern.
        Parameters:
        inCommand - command which can be IBaseCommand, IEntityCommand or ICommand
        Returns:
        wrappped command

      • displayMessagesIfNeeded

        public static boolean displayMessagesIfNeeded(MessageCollector inMsgs,
                                              MessageLevel inLevel,
                                              PropertyKey inPrefaceDescription,
                                              PropertyKey inTitle)
        This method displays messages if there are any to display. It will return true if there were messages to display, otherwise, it will return false. The messages are first ordered by severity with highest severity messages displayed first.
        Parameters:
        inMsgs - The messages to display.
        inLevel - The lowest level of message to display (all messages at or above this level are displayed).
        inPrefaceDescription - Optional description shows on top of the message.
        inTitle - Optional title of the dialog. Good default is not to use it.
        Returns:
        true if there are messages to be displayed

      • displayMessagesIfNeeded

        public static boolean displayMessagesIfNeeded(java.util.Iterator inMsgs,
                                              MessageLevel inLevel,
                                              PropertyKey inPrefaceDescription,
                                              PropertyKey inTitle)
        This method displays messages if there are any to display. It will return true if there were messages to display, otherwise, it will return false. The messages are first ordered by severity with highest severity messages displayed first.
        Parameters:
        inMsgs - The messages to display.
        inLevel - The lowest level of message to display (all messages at or above this level are displayed).
        inPrefaceDescription - Optional description shows on top of the message.
        inTitle - Optional title of the dialog. Good default is not to use it.
        Returns:
        true if there are messages to be displayed

        Returns:
        ICarinaUIEventManager

      • convertFieldValueToString

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String convertFieldValueToString(java.lang.Object inValue)
        Converts the value to a string.It is used to display a value in a ui widget. For arrays comma separated values are shown within square braces [abc, cde], if the number of values is too large only partial values are shown [abc, cde, fgh...]
        Parameters:
        inValue - value to be converted
        Returns:
        string representation of value
